posts.post_content: Not as good as it looks. I've seen people lose Limited games because they pull this jank and cast it on turn 4, but they really need a blocker to stop early game attackers. This thing can't block, and even if it attacks, I'd rather take the 2 damage each turn if I'm dealing that much or more in return every time I attack.

Posted By: Goatllama (4/11/2012 3:56:09 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
DrJones, you are so close to being absolutely right.   
  
It's just a shame that Stormbound Geist costs ![1](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=1&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol)![Blue](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=U&type=symbol) and this ![3](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=3&type=symbol)![Black](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=B&type=symbol): it's a lot more colour-heavy. It's like comparing a [Leatherback Baloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Leatherback Baloth) to a [Trained Armodon](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Trained Armodon). ALTHOUGH Leatherback is 3-cmc and a 4/5 versus a 3-cmc 3/3, the colour weight is what kills Leatherback. You must be playing mono-green, or have some kind of [Prismatic Omen](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Prismatic Omen) out to get the green.  
  
Still, you're right: Flying + able to block only flying + 3-cmc is a HUGE advantage.
posts.html:
DrJones, you are so close to being absolutely right.

It's just a shame that Stormbound Geist costs and this : it's a lot more colour-heavy. It's like comparing a Leatherback Baloth to a Trained Armodon. ALTHOUGH Leatherback is 3-cmc and a 4/5 versus a 3-cmc 3/3, the colour weight is what kills Leatherback. You must be playing mono-green, or have some kind of Prismatic Omen out to get the green.

Still, you're right: Flying + able to block only flying + 3-cmc is a HUGE advantage.
